meanings.definition: A ball of snow pressed or rolled together.
meanings.sent1: The children built a big snowball in the yard.
meanings.sent2: I threw a snowball at my friend during the snowball fight.
meanings.sent3: The snowball rolled down the hill, getting bigger and bigger.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a snowball, infectious and growing.
meanings.sent5: The snowball gleamed in the sunlight, a perfect sphere of white.

meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in size or significance.
meanings.sent1: The excitement began to snowball as more people joined the event.
meanings.sent2: His savings started to snowball once he invested wisely.
meanings.sent3: The gossip about the new student began to snowball around the school.
meanings.sent4: The project's success snowballed, exceeding all expectations.
meanings.sent5: The small mistake snowballed into a major issue for the company.

meanings.definition: To throw snowballs as a form of play.
meanings.sent1: We used to snowball fight every winter with our neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The kids love to snowball each other when the first snow falls.
meanings.sent3: She challenged him to a snowball duel, laughing all the while.
meanings.sent4: The siblings snowballed in the backyard, enjoying the winter day.
meanings.sent5: The friends decided to snowball instead of having a traditional snowman.
